results.title: Old masters, new visions: from the Phillips Collection
results.creator_credit: Robert Walker, Steve Isaac, Australian Capital TV and Australian National Gallery
results.brief_description: This video features a selection from the 71 works exhibited as the “Old Masters-New Visions” exhibition, from the Phillips Collection, Washington DC, at the Australian National Gallery, Canberra, the Art Gallery of Western Australia, Perth and the Art Gallery of South Australia, Adelaide. The video was shot in the Australian National Gallery and features the works of El Greco, Goya, Chardin, Ingres, Constable, Courbet, Monet, Cezanne, Renoir, Van Gogh, Rousseau, Marc, Kandinsky, Bonnard, Braque, Matisse and Rothko.

results.title: Old man possum
results.brief_description: Gives details of the animal, its characteristics and its food habits. Compares the Australian marsupial with the American opossum. Shows types of possums, including gliding phalangers of all sizes, the ring-tailed possum, the cuscus and many others. Also shows the research work on the physiology of marsupials being carried out on the brush-tailed possum at Sydney University.

results.title: Old ground new ground school ground
results.creator_credit: John Nicoll and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: An interview based documentary in which six Melbourne school students from non-English speaking backgrounds talk freely about themselves, their feelings and aspirations, and their experiences in Australian schools and Australian society.

results.title: Old dogs, new tricks
results.brief_description: You learn till you die … it’s the only way. Diminishing mental faculties are not a necessary outcome of old age. This heartening film focuses on a number of people for whom retirement and old age have only served as a springboard to new activities and skills. It clearly demonstrates that stimulation is an important part of keeping independent and motivated.

results.title: Oil: our hidden wealth
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Studies the search for oil in Australia, showing how oil is formed, the personnel and equipment needed in drilling a well, and how results of seismic recordings are interpreted. Describes actual drilling in Australia and Papua New Guinea.
